Thing.description: The most general type of entity in the ontology, representing any object or concept.

UnrecognizedEntity.description: A placeholder for an entity that was detected but could not be classified into a more specific type.

Communication.description: A generic communication entity that can represent emails, calls, meetings, or any other form of communication.

type.description: Type of communication (email, call, meeting, etc.)

status.description: Status of the communication (received, processed, archived, failed)

subject.description: Subject or title of the communication

body.description: Content or body of the communication

CONTAINS_ENTITY.description: Links a communication to entities mentioned or involved in it

PARTICIPANT_IN.description: Links an entity (person, organization) to communications they participated in

SENDER_OF.description: Links a sender entity to communications they sent

RECIPIENT_OF.description: Links a recipient entity to communications they received

SIMILARITY_RELATIONSHIP.description: Generic similarity relationship between any two entities

factors.description: List of factors used in similarity calculation

algorithms.name: GENERIC_SIMILARITY
algorithms.description: Generic similarity relationship between any two entities

SIMILARITY_RELATIONSHIP.customQuery: MATCH (entity1)-[r:SIMILARITY_RELATIONSHIP]->(entity2) WHERE r.score > 0.7 RETURN entity1.name as entity1Name, entity2.name as entity2Name, r.score as similarity, r.similarityType as type ORDER BY r.score DESC
